Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: bagladyolg
Reviews.Content: After spending 2 nights at a gaming hotel, we moved over here and were very pleased to have done so. They were undergoing some construction so the elevators were very slow but I don't think that will be a problem when they finish. It was just such a pleasure to be able to walk into the hotel, through the lobby and up to our room in a matter of minutes as opposed to walking through a noisy casino, although I know that is why alot of people go to Las Vegas. The pool area was clean and tidy and easily accessible. The rooms were great. We had a one bedroom suite with a kitchen and washer and dryer. The room was clean and the bathroom was nice and big. It is definitely off the main drag but we had a rental car so it wasn't a problem getting around. There is a little coffee shop and mini grocery downstairs where you can get food. We bought coffee and bagels and brought them up to the room where we could eat at our leisure. It was a nice change from having to eat at a busy hotel dining room. A freat place and I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adolmoni
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here last week, and i had a very nice overall experience. Staff was very helpfull and friendly, hotel was very clean and modern, and the pool was fantastic. Location is a bit out of the main strip and you do need a vechicle to get around. If you are here for a conference the hotel is located right next door. There is no restaurant or casino on site.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Good location for Convention Center. Nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: dfndr90
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in the Hilton Grand Vacation by the Las Vegas Convention Center. This is a great location if you are exhibiting or attending an event at the convention center. It is off the strip, and you either have to take the monorail or a cab to get to the strip. I took the monorail, which was a great way to get around. The rooms in the hotel are renovated and like new. They are clean, modern, large and comfortable. It is so nice to have a refrigerator, microwave, toaster, and coffee maker in the room. The room was nice and large, I didn't feel like I was staying in a box. The room also had a blu-ray player. They also offer free wi-fi which is a plus. The deli and market have a great selection of drinks, snacks, alcohol, and other items. The deli offers sandwiches for breakfast, and lunch. Also a nice selection of pastries. If you don't mind a bit of a walk, there is an AM/PM down the street. The pool and grounds are very nice. There are two lounges to hang out. There is an active lounge with ping-pong, pool, and a large screen TV. There is also a quiet lounge if you want some peace and quiet to read or just relax. I would recommend this hotel, especially for $99/night. It is nice to walk in and go right up to your room and not have to walk through a smoky casino.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet place to stay - just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: notamac
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the 2-room suites. Had a decent view of one end of the strip. The room was great - we didn't care for the view from a different room so the staff let us check a couple rooms for a better view. They cared about our comfort and enjoyment. Don't stay here if you want a casino in your hotel. It's a nice, quiet place to stay. We thoroughly enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and exceeds all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Honestopinionalways1
Reviews.Content: i was so pleasently suprised to find this gem of a hotel!!! just so well located and so glad i didnt stay on the strip. there is ample parking and the suite we stayed in was phenominal they have through of everything and the service was super gold star!! i did not want to leave and my husband and daughter felt the same. the tubs had jacuzzi's and the beds were so comfortable even the toiletries were peter thomas roth which i love!! didnt even need to pack my toiletries> very near the strip we took a cab there and it was just minutes away. i will be returning to fully enjoy it more

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but under construction.”
Reviews.Author: SusanPitman
Reviews.Content: Loved the room--we had a suite with a king-sized bed. Wonderful big tub, great shower, nice and clean. We had paid for a bed-and-breakfast deal, though; but the dining area is apparently under construction (as is half the hotel) so we were only given a voucher for coffee, orange juice, and a sandwich in their convenience store. I'm sure once the construction is done, the hotel will be much better. But we absolutely loved our room. The hotel staff is very nice, and the hotel is a very short walk from the monorail, and from the 108 bus, which will get you most places you want to go. When we return to Vegas, we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Grimy Slimy and obnoxious”
Reviews.Author: HighTechTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a single night at the HGV at the convention center. The first impression I got when I walked in was bad - there was a bad odor in the lobby and the common areas looked sticky. Kind of reminded me of a seedy motel. The check-in process was painful, even though I was the only one checking in, it took 15 minutes - I would guess it was a new guy, since he kept making mistakes and no one was helping him. When I walked in the room, it was big and had all the appliances - which would be good for anyone looking to live there.The room was not well maintained and was dusty. The bed was not very comfortable. I was very happy I checked out the following morning.

Reviews.Title: “Quite place in loud Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lvs23
Reviews.Content: I think it not easy to find some quite, decent and not outrageously expensive place to stay in Vegas. I believe this was one to go to. There are two things that helps it - no casino on premises and almost at the end of the strip (by Stratospere). Both of these were not an issue for us as we always rent a car while in Vegas. We stayed two night in 1 bedroom suite over the Fri-Sat night which ended up being cheaper than even in 3 star Stratosphere quite (after all the fees added). It was a large apartment with full sized kitchen and Jacuzzi tub. The hotel was very quite and after going out all night we could come back and catch up on sleep in a what I'd say sleep friendly environment. The staff is very friendly and they were fast in processing our check-in and check-outs. I wish I would have discovered this property earlier but going forwards this would be our preferred place to stay whenever we are in Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: Uglybugs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this apartment hotel on numerous occasions. The accommodation and set I've has been first class without reservation. I must say that we have been treated in a first class way.by Bill Becker. He has now departed to another hotel however I am sure that all will be fine when we return for February..April and May 2012. Watch this space and I will advise in a true English way.

Reviews.Title: “Great off-strip location with convenient parking”
Reviews.Author: UWHusky1968
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nites, just before Super Bowl Sunday, in a studio unit which seemed to have been just remodeled as everything seemed new from the bathroom to the king size bed and even the coffee maker and toaster. We liked the off-strip location that shares the parking structure with the LV Hilton hotel. Parking was easy and convenient and it was about a 10 minute walk thru the parking structure to the hotel casino and restaurants. The staff were all friendly and helpful - check in/out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Short walk to monorail”
Reviews.Author: eggegm
Reviews.Content: Stayed for week. Room was a suite with full living room and kitchen. Bed was very comfortable. No restautants in this hotel so either plan on eating elsewhere or get morning sandwich from hotel deli/store. Concerge and hotel staff extremely helpful and Friendly. We took monorail to strip it was right next store at the Vegas Hotel which has a great buffet for breakfast.Plenty of parking and very easy to get to highways and to airport(4 miles straight shot).

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Carldaddy
Reviews.Content: For several years I have worked an annual industry trade show in Las Vegas, and for the last three years I have spent the week at this property, which is a 7 minute walk to the convention center. The one bedroom units are clean, quiet and good sized, and it is great to have some room to relax in after a day on my feet. There is also a good sized Jacuzzi tub to soak in, and the beds are comfortable. The suites come with a complete kitchen with utensils, serving plates and cookware with dishes for four and there is an Albertson’s Market less than a mile away. (East on Karen Ave to S Maryland Parkway, located in the plaza on your right) I will usually cook several meals in the suite rather than fight the crowds, and breakfast without having to get dressed is always nice. There are also a couple of gas grills in the pool area to grill on. My total food cost for the week was just over $100.00 because I like to cook, but the restaurants and casino at the LVH property are less than a three minute walk if you are in the mood for more activity, unlike the Vacation Club on Las Vegas Blvd which is somewhat isolated. There is also a monorail stop in the LVH which can get you to the busy part of the strip for $5.00. I highly recommend this property if you are looking for a quiet, comfortable place to stay while needing access to the convention center..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Not in the strip”
Reviews.Author: nunezjorge88
Reviews.Content: This is an all suites hotel. Recently renovated. We got a one bedroom suite, It had a big bathtube, a shower, a very big bathroom a fully equiped kitchen (Oven, Microwave, dishwasher, dishes, glasses, big fridge, etc). The bedroom had a kingsize bed and in the living room there was a sofa bed, two 32inches lcd tvs and bluray players were available in the room. All carpets and furniture were new and smelled like new, I really think this hotel was our best option. It has a pool, not to big but is enough, not used by ourselves, it was cold outside. The staff was very helpful and polite. You dont get bored at this hotel, woth BBQ grills in the courtyard, and a games room. Not a casino here, but there are a lot in the strip. I recommend it as one of the best hotel I have ever been.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: MarcoTarpi
Reviews.Content: Excellence place to stay, good confort and clean room. I stayed there three days and also baby was always in good condition. Very close to downtown and very quite: I'll return in this hotel the next time. Good breakfast and restaurants. Great time !!!!!!!! I suggest you to go there to life Las vegas and its casinos

Reviews.Title: “Everything i expected and more.”
Reviews.Author: nicksair
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation for a 1 night stay here Sunday Night into MLK Jr. Day at the last minute when i had got into town. Great rate too after the AAA discount. I had requested a room on a high floor and away from the elevator when i had checked in, and they accommodated that request. Got a 15th floor room overlooking the eastern part of the Valley. The room was larger than i was expecting, the bathroom, while a little small, did its job, so i had no problem with the size. The free parking is a huge plus and well lit at night. I think what stands out for me and others is, the location in relation to the strip, while off of the strip, you are not far from the action if you desire to go there. I generally dont as i've seen it enough, and this was a visit to see friends and family who live in the area. If you want to be close, but not right on the strip. I think this is the place for you. I'll most definitely stay here again when i need a hotel in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: WyoBus
Reviews.Content: After we discovered the HGV, we continue to return here on every trip to Vegas. We love the King Suite with jetted tub, kitchen, large comfortable living area and washing machine and drier. Lovely pool/hot tub area as well a small but adequately stocked shop where you can purchase a light meal. Just a block off the strip so peaceful but still within easy reach of all the entertainment Vegas has to offer

Reviews.Title: “Good quality with very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Alexander Z
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent value for the price, and overall high quality. We had a single room suite with small kitchen with microwave etc. Hotel is not at the strip, and is not a casino, the quality is compared to a normal Hilton hotel chain most likely comparable with a very good 4* property. There is a small shop to buy everything you need with a reasonable price, of course going to a supermarket is cheaper, but I was still impressed by low prices. Room was renovated in a timeless nice quality, good bed, large TV, practical bathroom with bathtube with shower. Staff was very friendly everywhere in the hotel, concierge was able to organize everything. We planned to spend one week in Las Vegas and booked by intention not at the strip to have some quite time. There is a Monorail station and a bus stop 300m away from the hotel, making it easy to get to the strip within some minutes by bus and with the monorail to the largest hotels. The Stratosphere tower is in walking distance (12 min). I think key to know is that the hotel is not at the strip, and even if you walk to the strip to the Stratosphere tower then you're in the most northern part of the strip. to get to Venecian/Bellagio etc you need to take bus/Monorail/Taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Convenient, Central & off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Chrystal H
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week here on our first trip to Lost Wages. We're non smokers & non gamblers, and still found a ton of things to do. It's right on the monorail trail, $5 a trip or $12 for 24 hours. Do the 24 hour one. Go out in the evening and go out out again in the morning on the same ticket. No lineups to check in or out, no casino to walk through to get to the front desk. Self parking directly out front, minimal walking. The concierges are very friendly and helpful, and have discount show & restaurant tix if you ask. This property is a time share, so be careful you don't get sucked into a sales talk in return for free show tickets. The pool is open all year round. There's a little over priced deli/store on site, but well stocked & convenient. A games room for the kids. Lobby will start being renovated Feb/12. The rooms were finished just last week. They're good sized rooms, ours was a studio, fresh & new decor, still has that new car smell, with a kitchenette, but no stove. Tip the housekeeper well, and she'll do your dishes and maybe leave extra coffee for you. The bathroom was minuscule. The door cleared the toilet by 1/4". We were on the top floor and had an excellent view, although part of it was of the parking garage. There was free wifi but the hotel internet was .50 a minute. I saw it as cheap as .25 a min, so hunt around. The big old Hilton, soon to be renamed LVH, is directly next door with all the amenities and a pretty good buffet. The best one is at the Fremont hotel, right on Fremont st., for 15.00 for dinner. We'll stay here again. We love Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme Comfort & Space with a View”
Reviews.Author: STraveler2
Reviews.Content: There are lots of Hilton's in Las Vegas. This Hilton Grand Vacation Suite on Karen Avenue is quiet, convenient, recently upgraded, comfortable and had a great view. We loved the separate living room, the full kitchen and the view of the Stratosphere Tower. In Las Vegas, unless you use valet parking, you can walk a mile from your car to your room, but this parking was convenient. It is also a short walk to the monorail and the larger Hilton Casino with its restaurants, shops and entertainment. If you need to be at the convention center, it's also a short walk through the larger Hilton. All in all I would highly recommend. Extremely comfortable, clean, convenient and relaxing. About a block 'off the strip' but monorail takes you to the strip. .

Reviews.Title: “One pleasant night in a small room”
Reviews.Author: saranger
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here last week. Spent four total in Las Vegas in different properties to retain diamond level for 2012. Check-in with Julian was efficient. Only problem was we had reserved room on different credit card than we paid for. Deposit not automatically refunded (we had to call this week and specifically ask that charge be reversed). Given a studio room on 14th floor with view of golf course. Nicely remodeled, but room was our smallest in our Las Vegas stay at 4 Hilton properties. Wouldn't want to be here for more than a few nights. Room was quiet and well-lit. Too cold to use pool, but it looked lovely. Free wifi to HHonors Gold/Diamond. No breakfast offerings for Diamond HH members nor free public computer (like Hampton or Doubletree), but quiet and active lounges were nicely outfitted for fun and relaxation. One packet of coffee provided, no matter how long your stay. Additional coffee available for purchase in the on-site store. Stayed here about 7 years ago (in Feb) and would like to visit when warmer to take advantage of the pool. Off-Strip location is great for family or non-casino types. If you have a car you're a short drive to many restaurants. Fridge and microwave allow for easy re-heat of leftovers. Would return but I also know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “My Home in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMaryland
Reviews.Content: I come to Vegas for Work about 4-6 times every year and this is my favorite place to stay. Five reasons why staying here is perfect for someone who's not too interested in the excitement of the strip: 1. The amazing Staff- from Front Desk to Housekeeping, this property employs wonderful, kind and friendly people. The ladies in the Deli are my favorites- and I love Martin at the front desk. 2. The Deli/ Grocery Store- I work long days when I am here and the convenience of having a mini-grocery and deli right dowstairs is such a nice perk. They have wine and beer and made to order breakfast, lunch and dinner. 3. The rooms- super clean, very quiet and the beds are so comfy 4. The location- off the beaten track but convenient to the LVCC and within walking distance to the Monorail 5. NO CASINO! :)

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of silence yet close to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Alexx84
Reviews.Content: We came there after almost 3 weeks of travelling for relax. There is no casino in-house which I see as benefit as if you want it, you can go downtown. It is only minutes away from Monorail an the Strip, but it gives you nice silent break. Nice pool, not big, but bigger than the averige motel one.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: U646
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property. We had one of the rooms that has been recently renovated. I was very impressed. They have done a wonderful job updating this property. We parked in the Hilton Casino North Parking Garage. Just drive straight up to the fourth level. You can park right next to the elevator. The rear door by the pool leads straight to the hotel elevators. Very quick in and out. We had a nice view of Las Vegas Country Club and mountains off in the distance. We have stayed at The Hilton Vaction Club on the strip before. This property is a very nice alternative to that. Certainly this is a better opion if you dont have children. This property is smaller and more relaxing. The pool is not as big as the Hilton Vacation Club on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A bit better than expected in some ways, worse in others.”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyerYYZ
Reviews.Content: We were given one of the recently refurbished suites on an upper floor. Most everything felt nearly new although stark. Yes, there is noise during daytime hours (Nov 2011) from construction in the building and we spent one day (out of 9 day stay) with water shut off from 10am-3pm which was inconvenient but understandable. written notice was provided the day before. Lobby area is a bit tired. Pool area is small. building is pretty much isolated and surrounded by parking lots. You will want to have a car as you are a 10 minute walk from the strip and as far north as you would want to be, considering the unsavory areas north. Monorail station is a 5 minute walk but it is pretty much a white elephant with limited stops in addition to being expensive. We are HGVC owners but got pressured into listening to an upgrade pitch, in exchange for a Hilton comp or free shows. It was interesting to watch the sales pro's at work but spent a solid 3 hours in exchange for $90 worth of comps. Should have just said no. Problems with unit: Black out curtains are filthy. Must have been marked up during recent reno. No sheers. Ice maker in fridge makes mouldy ice. Electrical socket in kitchen tripped circuit breaker a few times ( maybe a ground fault).

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: wmlv
Reviews.Content: Live in Las Vegas and was attending an event at the LV Hilton. Have stayed at the Hilton before but decided to try the Grand Vacation property since it shares the same parking lot and garage. Great room! Only got to stay one night. Was upgraded to a one bedroom suite that was newly renovated. Full kitchen with all amenities.....even a new blender and pull-out faucet in the sink. Better than my house. The jet tube was large and deep. Two large flat screen tv's. The room also has its own washer and dryer and free internet. I used the Hilton web site and booked with AAA rate. The front desk attendant (Kari?) was wonderful. Very upbeat and friendly. I will still here again whenever I get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay for Convention”
Reviews.Author: KenandShenea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton GV after researching several properties recommended by the organization hosting the convention. We chose this property based on the reviews from Trip Advisor guests and couldn't have been happier. We knew it was off the strip -- which wasn't a concern to us. Taxi's were mainly easy to come by. You can also call the front desk and they will call for a taxi for you. Taxi from airport was about $30. Taxi to old downtown was about $15. Taxi to strip anywhere from $10-$20 depending on which part of the strip you are going. The hotel is lovely -- extremely clean and very nice. We had a suite on the 12th floor, gorgeous, brand new. Kitchenette, fridge, micro, all the utensils, pans, dishes, awesome. Little mini mart on main level -- pricy but great to pick up a loaf of bread and dozen eggs, gallons of water for the room. Doubl sink bathrooms, spacious shower -- beautiful jacuzzi (never used but it looked nice). The only funny thing in the bathroom was the height of the mirror. My husband is about 6'1" or so and he had to hunch a bit to fit in the mirror. Beds are nice, I've stayed at Hilton Hotels before and had better pillows, pillows are OK. Pool is nice, shady till about 9:30 or 10:00 then full sun till about 4:30 or 5:00 then sun is behind buildings. Maids did a really good job -- tip them well -- every single day. We never had the same maid. Bless their hearts for cleaning up after us and being exposes to the chemicals and the labor. They are in the process of remodeling their rooms - very nice. They notified us at check in that the workers will work from 9a-5p every day and they did, lots of banging if you are in the room you can hear this. One day I heard it for a couple hours while getting ready. But ended right on time. They do say they keep the floor directly above and below empty but construction noise travels. This is right next to Hilton which is connected to the Convention Center -- many people stayed at that hotel as part of the convention and said it was a dump. This is SO WORTH the 5 minute walk. Easy, easy, easy. Monorail is easy to use - we used it once to get to Harrah's for their Oyster Bar. GREAT but a lil spendy at $25 a dozen. Tried to use it two other times and it was out of commission. Don't rely on it soley.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, but isolated.”
Reviews.Author: FunkShaman
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel: The staff was very accommodating and helpful. Worst thing about this hotel: The Location. It is off-strip with no regular taxi traffic, so you will need to call for a taxi pickup, which will take 10-15 minutes minimum. The hotel is on the edge of some pretty sketchy neighborhoods, and about a 15 minute walk the strip. (But you can walk next door to the LV Hilton and catch the monorail. But I would not advise walking to and from this hotel to anywhere, unless you are in a group. Suites are spacious, very well laid out and well appointed. Furniture is a bit dated, but in very good condition (the building is under renovation as of 10/31/11) and the furniture is being refreshed. The amenities are very basic - there is a deli and a convenience store, but no full service restaurant or room service.

Reviews.Title: “First stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: moprep
Reviews.Content: After about 18 trips to Las Vegas, my first hotel stay off the strip was at the Hilton Grand Vacations Suites at the Convention Center. I am happy to report that I will never stay at a Strip hotel again unless absolutely necessary. As I always rent a car, the convenience of this property is great. Staying off the Strip allows you to get around faster and easier. If you are not renting a car, there is a monorail stop at the Hilton, which is next door, and a quick 5 minute walk. As for the hotel, it's unusual to stay 4 nights and not have any issues, no matter how minor. Bed was comfortable, shower was good, amenities were more than adequate, and a very friendly staff everywhere in the hotel you go. And no resort fee, a common charge everywhere else in LV. This place will definitely get my repeat business!

Reviews.Title: “One my preferred HGVCs in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bayarearesi
Reviews.Content: One of Hilton's Newer Grand Vacation locations. We stayed in a 3 bedroom 2 bath suite. Great room, clean. Love the kitchen and master bathroom. It's about a 5 10 minute drive to the main strip and about a 20 - 30 min walk to the Encore shopping center. My preference is to stay off the strip and avoid the crazy traffic, so the place works well for my family. It's has great access to the highway too for easy detours away from the strip for hiking at the Valley of Fire and Red Rock. Definitely will return to this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Meet our needs.”
Reviews.Author: aussiecocky
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because is was not near the Strip, no casino and stated as "family friendly". It meet our needs completely including the on site deli. The staff were helpful and friendly, the room excellent even with building works overhead but they finished by 5pm. Only wish the Hilton hotel names were not so similar as the Grayline shuttle took us to the wrong Hilton, even though we had told him which Hilton we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “outsatnding in every way except location.”
Reviews.Author: TheScanian
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel at a great value. Rooms are clean,staff is awesome, a 2 minute walk to the LV Hilton no complaints at all about the hotel except...location..The LV Hilton is a real dive and it is a 10-15 walk to the Strip through fairly "iffy' neighborhoods. If you are with a group no problem, but I would not walk there alone late at night. I would definitely stay there again, but be prepared to walk.

Reviews.Title: “It Really Just Sucked”
Reviews.Author: SteelBeach
Reviews.Content: There are probably 100 better places in Las Vegas. First of all, it really isn't near anything else except the Hilton which is probably a 5-10 minute walk across the parking lot. Sometimes there is a cab outside, but, if there aren't, you're walking back to the Hilton. They have a nice deli place - but it closes at around 9 (I think). Housekeeping is useless - one day they didn't bother to clean up the little kitchen area and the next day they never got to cleaning the room by the time I returned from business meetings at 3:00. I called and asked when they could do it (I wanted to get some rest) AND THEY COULDN'T EVEN GIVE ME A TIME. Other people have mentioned the construction and it sucked, too. Just a bad experience all the way around. There are far better places to stay in Las Vegas at a much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, nice, large”
Reviews.Author: rockies411
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while waiting for another hotel's reservations. Had king suite, it was huge, quiet and nice. Quite a bargain! Easy access to strip via short walk to Hilton for Monorail ride. Nice place if you want to stay in vegas, but be able to get away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “The full kitchen spelled the difference with a real surprise bonus, NO CASINO.”
Reviews.Author: Amigomo
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter wanted to see the strip but not the casinos. The lights but not the smoke and lotsa people. The sober people not the drunks and gamblers. The sunlight but with the pool. The clean shower but the jacuzzi was a real treat/surprise. The strip was seen from the window but not as close to the maddening crowd. The Hilton grand suites was just awesome.

Reviews.Title: “vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: valeofclyde
Reviews.Content: Good hotel friendly staff nice location quiet area,handy for Hilton hotel and casino,close to Monorail which takes you all over strip to MGM Grand.The hotel has a nice cafe and lounge area.The pool is handy for guests.The only flaw is check in is not till 4.00 p.m. and our Westjet flight had us there at 10.00 a.m. and we had to store our luggage etc. and wander . All in all very good.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: alan w
Reviews.Content: this is the place to stay if you want to be away from the turmoil that is Las Vegas.Go where you want very easily during the day and night and then go back to this place and enjoy the peace and quiet, Has everything you need and you can walk to the hilton casino. Staff here were the best,especially the front desk and deli. We had a 1 bedroom for a great price and the kitchen is there if you need it,but with the hiton over the road and lunch and dinner buffets for 15 and 20 dollars all you can eat and drink,why cook. Going again next year and will stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great business experience”
Reviews.Author: Brad-martin
Reviews.Content: Was at the LVH Convention Center for a conference. The apartment style of the room made for a stay that allowed more of a feeling of coming home after work. The ample living area with separate bedroom took away that clostrifobic feeling of a regular hotel room. The kitchen allowed me to buy and cook my own food and make snacks and a bag lunch to take to the trade show booth with me. Overall it was easier on the show budget without having to spend money in restaurants each evening and made me less inclinded to go out with such a relaxing and roomy environment to come back to each day after long hours on the tradeshow floor. The decorating could use some modernization, but that is my only suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but really needs to step it up..”
Reviews.Author: CamandKay
Reviews.Content: My husband I went to the resort from Sept 10th-Sept 15th. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit which is actually a 1 bedroom with a lock out studio. For years the HGVC at the Las Vegas Hilton has always received the better reviews of the the other two. ( one on the north strip and the one at the Flamingo) This was our first visit to this property. We stayed about 5 years ago at the Flamingo HGVC. I must say, the Flamingo property is a bit nicer. I have no information about the newest one on the North end of the strip. We exchanged our timeshare and were notified one week before our travel of CONSTRUCTION. I completely understand that this must happen at every resort but i wish they would have notified us before we booked the resort. Thank goodness we were early risers because you could hear the jack hammering from 9am to at least 4pm every day. They also gave us a nice sheet of paper at check in advising us that there would be no water in the room from 10-3 on wednesday. In vegas that probably would not be a bad thing in the middle of the day but it was just another thing that frustrated me. The rooms are nice but again in need of an upgrade. I believe they have 17 floors and they have started the renovation and are only on the 16th. They started at the top. We were on the 7th floor and we could hear the noise very clearly. ( I feel sorry for the people that were higher than us) It was nice to get away from all that smoke. The Las Vegas Hilton is a short walk away and so is the Monorail. The Las Vegas Hilton is a bit outdated but they appear to be renovating it as well. We rented a car so we were in and out and had no issues with transportation. The deli and store there is small but nice and semi reasonable. The pool is cute but i was actually surprised how small it was. I cant imagine it being sufficient in the summer with the resort being full. They have two different lounges with a pool table and ping pong area. They have a computer in the other lounge. The gym was pretty good. We had a good time and i am glad they are updating the resort. I dont think i would return to this spot for awhile. The staff was friendly and no complaints about that. I was just a bit annoyed that we did not know about the construction until a week before we were to arrive and we could have gone elsewhere and not have dealt with the jack hammer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: g35girl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay in a 1 bedroom suite. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable, however the entire suite was very, worn and dated. The wallpaper peeling off the walls, furniture and carpet heavily stained and old, picture tube TVs (hahaha). I won't comment on the location as others have covered that, however I will mention that if you want the "Vegas" experience this hotel is not it for you. Also, just for clarification...there are smoking rooms available. I was asked at check-in if I have a preference. Perhaps, only the 1 bedroom suites have that option, but the entire hotel is not smoke free. Personally, I would not stay at this property again, primarily because of the location. For the price I paid, I could have stayed on the strip and had more options for food & entertainment within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “this let's the secret out”
Reviews.Author: liveandlearn99
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to write this review at the risk of not getting a reservation when I want it. This was a great hotel for us, but might not work out for people with small children. We usually stay at the HGVC on the strip when in Vegas but tried this and really liked it. The parking situation is so easy here and no addl charges for it. We didn't use the little deli-it is expensive and with kitchen facilities its smarter for us to go a couple miles and buy groceries. The pool isn't very big but we were well able to swim laps on the diagonal and the pool was never very busy. There aren't any fun additions (lazy river, etc) that kids look for in a pool which probably explains why we only saw 2 kids there in the 6 days we stayed. Barbq grills are easily accessed right by the pool. Tools for the barbq are available to use from the deli. There is an offer to go take the vacation club talk on becoming an owner but they weren't pushy. At check-in we were clearly told construction was being done on the upper floors for updates. We stayed on a lower floor and never heard any noise. It was quiet and comfortable-just what we look for in a vacation stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Maverick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights during my business trip in Aug 2011. My one-bedroom suit was fully furnished with dishwasher, washer and dryer and sparkling clean every day (although room itself was a bit outdated). As other fellow travelers mentioned, hotel is 5 min walking distance to “monorail”, which makes the commute to the strip very convenient. The mini café in the lobby was also a nice touch for travelers to get a quick snack, coffee, etc (although very expensive). Used the pool once and it was cool! Gym was very well ventilated, the TV equipped treadmills being the highlights! Three minor complaints: 1) my 7:00 AM wake-up call rang at 5:00 AM and 2) water outages throughout the day was very inconvenient 3) internet speed was SLOW

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Time”
Reviews.Author: BMWorking
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for a reunion with friends from my military days...you know what they say about military, once a friends , always a friends. I stay at the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites - Las Vegas (Convention Center), which an excellent resort hotel one block off the strip with all the comfort of home. I had a one-bedroom suite with a large spa tub in a room between the bedroom and the bath/shower area. I had all the comforts that I would have had if I were of coming back to my own home...free Internet access, kitchen, dining area, living room, full king size bed, spa tub...which I don't have at home. The HGVC has a nice size swimming pool with a bar next to it, which is great because you can get a nice refreshing drink to cool off in the hot Vegas weather. They have an entertainment room with a pool table, meeting room, a quite room to go relax or read and a fitness center. Lastly, if you are on business they can handle that too in one of their conference rooms and they have a business room with computer and printer. The staff is very friendly and professional and they go out of their way to accommodate your wishes. I truly enjoyed my stay at the HGVC

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but not the worst”
Reviews.Author: jayers4
Reviews.Content: I thought a Hilton would be great, but I was not too impressed. The bed was very comfy and the room was very clean, but it was also very cold. The heat was not working properly and no one could fix it. The EnergyStar lights were very dim and half only turned on half of the time. Housekeeping came everyday to clean, which was nice. However, I ordered a food package to be delivered to my room, and it did not arrive until I called three hours after check in. Even then I got the run around on who to call. The front desk told me to call housekeeping who told me to call the deli who asked if I wanted to pick up the food. I said I thought it was being delivered. When it arrived, another 2 hours later, I was charged $8 for delivery. The deli was two floors down. Had I known that, I would have just picked it up. The TV and DVD player were nice. I don't think I would stay there again. It was just so-so. There is a small kitchenette in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place away from the mobs and craziness on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: SMFguy
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here......the place hasn't changed since our last visit 7 years ago. And, it's just as I remember it. Beautiful, spacious comfortable suites. Very nice pool area, well maintained. A mid-sized property that makes it feel not nearly as crowded as places on The Strip....or the Las Vegas Hilton right next door. Our 1 BR suite came with fully equipped kitchen and a large living room. Our friends stayed in a single room which is comparable to a Hilton Garden Inn type accommodation (microwave + fridge, no separate living or eating areas). Access to the monorail was very easy....only a short 5 minute walk away. However, if you plan on using the monorail as your primary transportation to/from The Strip, be prepared for a LOT of walking. All the stations are at the BACK of each resort and you have to traverse the casino and shops of each in order to get to Las Vegas Blvd. We bought a 3-day pass and used the monorail almost exclusively throughout our long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: Transcend68
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious which I love. They had a decent pool area. Two grill near the pool. Full kitchens. Off the strip. This is the perfect place to stay if you have kids. I reserved two one bedroom suites and I got them for less than $500 for the fourth of July weekend. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: avick2007
Reviews.Content: Since we were there for a convention at the convention center, this was a great location for us. The layout of the room was awesome...three girls and no trouble fitting! All three of us could do our make-up in the bathroom together and luggage was not in the way at all! It was great to have so much room. Also just a few minutes walk from the Hilton Monorail station which takes you right to the strip. We were also within walking distance of Bonanza, the largest gift shop in Vegas. Would stay here again, or at least would try for one of the other properties!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a spacious suite”
Reviews.Author: Peltt
Reviews.Content: We had a really enjoyable stay at the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites. Our suite had more space than the two of us really needed, but it helped make us feel right at home there for our four night stay. We visited a local supermarket and made our own meals using the kitchen facilities in our suite. We were also able to keep a stock of fresh clean clothes with the laundry facilities in the suite. There was ample storage space too for clothes and bags. The large bedroom and living room were both very comfortable and well furnished. It was good to return and relax there after hours of seeing the sights of Vegas. We used the open air pool each day and the hot tubs for some more exercise and relaxation. Parking space was always available near the hotel entrance. The best part of all was the great rate for our suite!

Reviews.Title: “What a great room! We will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: SDDay
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here before our drive to Phoenix. We had a one bedroom unit and the rate was super cheap. We would have loved to have spent several nights here. Close to tram to go to strip. Very quiet...

Reviews.Title: “Like test driving a go cart when they want to sell you a Mercedes....”
Reviews.Author: wolfwatcher2000
Reviews.Content: We agreed to sit through this time share ploy because of the good value for this extended weekend getaway. Thought we would at least be given a suite. Was told we had to pay an additional $35 to be bumped up from the studio to the suite. The room we received was smaller than a Hampton Inn (on the lower end of Hilton hotels). The room never cooled either of the two nights we stayed there. If you are looking for a clean room, don't mind the timeshare deal for about 2 hours and are planning on having a rental car, than you could consider staying here. If you are looking for something closer to the action and a little more luxurious, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: tfitz928
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed at a Hilton Grand Vacation property before but the price was right so I decided to try it. I was very pleasantly surprised. Lots of room, great location, very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable for family”
Reviews.Author: myli08
Reviews.Content: We loved the place and we will be back. They gave us the suite with kitchen and spa inside the room. My kids enjoy swimming downstairs. Facilities are clean and employees are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed ourstay at HGV Suites”
Reviews.Author: rayo91
Reviews.Content: We are RCI members and stayed for a week at the HGV on Las Vegas strip. It is very conveniently located and within walking distance to the famous hotels on the strip like Wynn, Treasure Island, Venetian, Paris etc. The service was good and the concierge staff extremely helpful. The hotel was clean and had very good amenities in the room like kitchenette, washing machine, dryer, microwave and a fridge. The view from the top floors was awesome. All in all an enjoyable experience and worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations and free parking!”
Reviews.Author: Sewaldro
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at the Las Vegas Convention Center and my husband came with me to Las Vegas. We enjoyed the nice accommodations at the Hilton Grand Vacations with a fully equiped kitchen, soft bed, large bathtub, and free parking! Most hotels charge for parking, so it was a breath of fresh air to have a large parking lot with plenty of open spaces and no charge daily. There was a security guard patrolling the lot as well. Also, my mother had a facial and pedicure at the Hilton Grand Vacation Spa (on the Las Vegas strip) and she received excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Wonderful Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: cbar0906
Reviews.Content: Stayed her with my family for 5 days. We had a 2 bedroom suite on the highest floor. It was a very well kept hotel. The rooms where huge. The kitchen was functional that has everything we needed. The main bedroom had a spa bath which my aunt loves. We had washer and dryer inside and a living living and dining area in between rooms. Staying here was very comfortable. They have sofa beds in the living room and in the second bedroom. The hotel's amenities was good. The only thing that would make this a perfect hotel was if it was a bit closer to the strip. A plus is their free WIFI connection. All in all it was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great family fun atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: seanmao858
Reviews.Content: Duration of Stay: 3 nights, May 27 - May 30 Occupants: Myself, 6 mo. pregnant Wife, 9yr old Son, Sister in Law, 2 friends Accommodations: 1 Bedroom Suite This resort is a little hidden but still easy to find, just remember it is on the corner of Paradise and Karen. Check-in was easy and the lobby is just excellent and clean. After checking in, our family approached the elevator and found that an inconsiderate person put out his cigarette butt in the elevator but other than that, my pregnant wife and my 9 year old son never ran into an incident where they smelled smoke. The resort staff quickly addressed the problem. Concierge was rude. We asked her questions about various shows and wanted to compare pricing between different seats. Our whole conversation did not even go on for 5 minutes and she just asked if she could help the person in line without even completing our conversation. I decided to order tickets through the Monte Carlo website instead of through her. Once we arrived in our 1 bedroom suite, we unpacked and went grocery shopping. It only cost our family approximately $60.00 to shop for all of us. That food provided breakfast, lunch, and late night snacks. We chose to shop at the nearby Smith's. When we got back we put all the food in the full-size fridge and found that the kitchen is already equipped with plates, eating utensils, pots & pans, dishwashing liquid, dishwashing scrubber, you name it. I cooked breakfast and lunch in the kitchen everyday for the family. Using the grill near the poolside is easy. Just go to the Deli to check out the BBQ utensils which include tongs, spatula, and grill scrubber. I grilled BBQ ribs and corn for the family. We later played ping pong in the recreational area. I wanted to use the pool table but my son was getting sleepy. The swimming pool is heated and has 2 Jacuzzis. Bathroom had 2 sinks so my wife and I were able to both brush our teeth, etc... at the same time. Overall, this stay was excellent. No smoke, no gambling, quiet atmosphere, and still close enough to the other casino hotels so that my wife and I could enjoy some shows!

Reviews.Title: “Good option amongst the myriad of hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: quarryking
Reviews.Content: Nice option, not too far from the strip. Took about 5 mins to get to the strip by taxi. Suites are large and therefore more suited for families or larger groups. No restaurant though in the hotel, but there's a small store where you pick up stuff to toss up a quick breakfast in the morning. There was a pool, which seemed to be pretty popular with the guests right thru the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: vld17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my sisters wedding. The front desk was very friendly and helpful all druing our stay. The rooms are nice and clean. There is no mall or shopping in this hotel, so if that is what you are looking for then this would probably not work for you, but overall I would recommend and go back to stay there again. It is not on the strip, but we loved the location. It was right on Monorail so getting to the strip was no problem. It was actually very nice to get away from the strip for a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Studios okay for leisure but not the best for business”
Reviews.Author: Conraveler
Reviews.Content: - Convention center walkable - Studios are one room with couch, kitchen sink, microwave, refrigerator, toaster, large coffeemaker - No desk - Small bathroom with worn bathtub/shower plumbing fixtures - Low water consumption toilet sometimes required two or three flushes - DVD player with CRT TV - A walk to the adjacent Hilton is past a free-standing parking garage - No complimentary breakfast - Only food is the deli/gift shop - Bar is usually only open when the pool is - First assigned room had dirty couch upholstery - Second assigned room had a chemical odor

Reviews.Title: “Working Vacation”
Reviews.Author: beachlover759
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property in a two bedroom suite for a week after a long weekend on the Strip celebrating a friend's birthday. The location is good if you don't want to be in the middle of all the action. It is convient to the monorail which takes you to all the action of the Strip within minutes. If you want to gamble but stay close you can walk over to the Las Vegas Hilton where they also have a variety of restaurants. The room decor is dated but I was informed by the bellman that they are starting a renovation of the rooms which is complete on the first floor. The thermostats did not regulate very well as it required constant modifications to keep the room comfortable. Free wireless internet service is provide which is a nice change from many hotels and/or resorts. The upkeep of the common areas is great as I find at all Hilton Grand Vacation properties. The deli available in the lobby is convenient but is a bit overpriced and needs to provide more options. Overall I found this property and its staff to be very nice.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Quite loaction - terrible noises!!”
Reviews.Author: lizp007
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in an apartment this time in Vegas for a change. The 2 room apartment was spacious & looked nice, although a little warn in places. But thank goodness we didn't have any neighbours the walls are almost paper thin. You can hear people in the next room talking as though they were in the same room with you! And then there's the plumbing - it is the noisiest I have ever come across in a hotel - water running, people in the bathroom above - I woun't go into detail as to what we could hear!! Staff were friendly & the loaction was quite but would not stay there again. I would only recommend this hotel to someone with hearing problems!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Timeshare "Special"”
Reviews.Author: TheTwoOfUsMidwest
Reviews.Content: This facility is decent enough: big rooms, comfy bed, ample free parking. However, it is a bit out of the way and with all of the other nice places to stay in Vegas, you can do better. The really disappointing part of our stay was the timeshare (Hilton Vacation Club) meeting and promotions. We thought we'd give it a try due to the strong Hilton name. Big mistake. They were very limiting on when you could schedule the meeting (10:00am or 3:00pm = right in the middle of your vacation day). They GUARANTEED that it would only last 2 hours. They PROMISED it would only last 2 hours. They kept us 2 hours and 35 minutes! We were told that the $200 Hilton voucher we would get would be good towards a future stay (multiple nights up to a total of $200). It's only good for 1 night. The sales pitch was an extremely hard sell. She wouldn't take "no" for an answer, even after I laughed at the $49 online reservation charge and the 17.5% interest rate they wanted to charge! So the only way I would suggest staying at the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites at the Las Vegas Convention Center is if you can get a good rate and NOT have to attend the timeshare sales meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Dated”
Reviews.Author: BusyTravelerCMH
Reviews.Content: Spouse and I stayed here last weekend (Feb 12-14) on a timeshare visit trip. Couple immediate points can be made: - Hotel is a long way from the strip. Probably 10 minutes walk so cab cost probably ate up any savings. Every cap ride was $10-$15 to the strip. The hotel is close the Las Vegas Hilton but that is really it. - There is no onsite food service besides a convenience store. - The front desk should tell ask if it is OK that you get a handicapped room instead of leave the surprise to you.. The room actually didn't appear to have any features for handicapped guests. - Furnishings were probably 10+ year sold. Serviceable, but faded linens and coach. Tube based TV that didn't swivel to orient towards the bed was a problem. - Admittedly we had a connecting door, but you should to hear as much from the room next door. Rooms are clean, but next time we will spend a little more to stay on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: heumanntouch
Reviews.Content: This is another property where if you were looking at it, you could not determine what lies inside. The room is spacious and elegant, and has everything you could need, washer, dyer, full kitchen, separate living room, bedroom. The best bonus is the parking is FREE, which is a bargain in Las Vegas. You are also very close to the Hilton Las Vegas and the tram way to take you to most places on the strip. I would recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families or long stays”
Reviews.Author: lugareslejanos
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with family including toddler. 1 bedroom Apartment/condo with full kitchen (with all tools and gadgets you may need for cooking and eating and washing dishes by hand or dishwasher), dining table for 4, sofa with queen bed, 3 sofa chairs, tv, dvd player, w/d and detergent, king size bed, jacuzzi tub, double sink, separate shower, and toiletries. Hotel has an activity room with pool table, pin pon table, and big tv. It also has another room with lots of sitting area, computers and printers. It has a deli/cafe/mini mart, no restaurant but then you have the kitchen to make meals or can go to one of the million places in vegas to eat. Hotel has no casino which was nice to us. Parking was right outside the hotel so didn't have to walk for miles before getting to our room. Hotel is off the strip but next to monorail which you can pay $12 for one day unlimited use and avoid all the traffic on the strip and finding parking. Grocery store, drug store, gas station, 7eleven, and restaurants within a mile. Staff were very nice and welcoming. Presentation for timeshare was not even brought up. Only negative would be about the carpet (blue) which stained our white socks. If you're not child/family friendly then this place is not for you as most of the guests are family w/ kids.

Reviews.Title: “Froze to death.....”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Frodo_Baggins
Reviews.Content: With 2 buddies we reserved 3 rooms and went for a weekend to Vegas in early November. Night temperatures were already pretty chilly. We arrived a 1.30am in the morning at the hotel. When we entered our rooms we were hit by a wave of ice cold air - no wonder - the aircon was fullblast on the coldest level. Even the immediate change to warm did not help and I was freezing the whole night. While at least they did not touch my aircon anymore, the room maid managed to put the aircon on cold again in my colleagues rooms.... In the morning we went to the welcome desk to pick up our "Welcome package". The lady there gave us some discount coupons, but mostly she wanted to lure us into visiting some time share apartments...... Bottom line: The rest was ok, the location close by the strip is ok, but I still would not recommend this hotel and never go back again - absolutely unworthy for the Hilton Group!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT listen to nay-sayers; this is a great place!”
Reviews.Author: jbwaaadeal
Reviews.Content: I travel and stay in hotels over 120 nights a year. I mostly stay in Hilton properties so when my five brothers and I decided on a brother reunion in Vegas, they said that I would take care of the hotel. I knew exactly where to call and from start to finish Bill at the desk and reservations was as fine a person to work with as there is anywhere in the country. Deb is fantastic, too. Although, you hear people say this is off the strip, who really cares? It is footsteps from the Strip and we had a rental car anyway and went from valet to valet. Valet is free everywhere and all you do is tip them. Plus, there is the train that comes there, as well, but we never had the need for it. The rooms are spacious and very clean. VERY clean. I would recommend this to anyone on business or with families. The pool area is just the right size especially if you have children. They won't get lost wondering in those huge newer pools. Although, I like those myself. You will not go wrong by staying here for any reason. I am on 120 flights a year and stay 120 nights a year and I know what I like. It is cleanliness and a smiling face most of all. Here they have both and lots of it!

Reviews.Title: “Just as great a second time”
Reviews.Author: JBien
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at this hotel last year for the same event, and this time booked a 1 bedroom suite for the same rate that we paid last year for a studio. We waited until a few days before we needed it to book, and we pre-paid to be able to take advantage of a special that gave you a room upgrade. The one bedroom was really spacious, and while not quite as swanky as the Signature at the MGM Grand that we had just come from, it still had everything we needed to make our stay comfortable and memorable. The full kitchen was a blessing, as we were able to cook for ourselves which was really convenient. There was a full-size drip coffee maker as well, though the coffee "mugs" were really tiny and we didn't bring travel mugs with us. The bathroom was plenty big, and the shower was convenient and comfortable. There was also a dining table and 4 chairs which made for comfortable dinners in the room. We used the pool this time, and enjoyed one of the hot tubs, though it was microscopic. More than 2 couples, and it's crowded. There are baskets out by the pool with white-and-yellow-striped pool towels for the guests. The pool bar is quite nice with drinks and appetizers, while the made-to-order deli/store is a great convenience to have right there in the property (and their breakfast burritos and pizzas are really good!). I think the elements that make this hotel so invaluable are their free parking, the ease of accessibility into/out of the property, and the proximity to the highway. We will definitely be staying here again. -Jen

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: erwin65
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacation in Las Vegas was a great experience. Spaceous rooms well equioted with all you need to relax was offered. There are two large rooms ( living room , bedroom) a kitchen fully equiped ( even washing machine and dryer) a great bathtube and a bathroom with shower. Great! The hotel offers a nice gym and a wonderful pool. A shop at lobby level offers all the small thinks you might need for your kitchen. Staff very friendly. Just great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the strip and convenient if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: RJDTravels
Reviews.Content: I was meeting up with some buddies from NYC for the weekend. They wanted to stay at the Aria but I was not interested in spending close to $250 Plus per night. I was very happy with my decision ($55 per night) The hotel had a decent in-house gym (whoo hoo!!Precor ellipticals!!), parking was easy, and free wi-fi. While decor of the room feels like something from the set of the Golden Girls, it was OK and comfortable. The bathroom shower was a bit dated and the pressure from the shower head was not that great. As far as the staff, they were very friendly and were able to accommodate me for an early check-in. The only thing I did not like about this property was a 10:00 AM check out. I am used to a 12 noon check out with the option of pushing it to 1:00 PM. Not so at this property.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home.”
Reviews.Author: Bakeriesworld
Reviews.Content: A home from home. A warm welcome for me as a first time business traveler to Las Vegas. Next time I do not hesitate to book again in this hotel. Helpfull staff, a small shop with to purchase verything you need with very helpfull staff, thank you ladies.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Close to the Wynn and Sahara - Just Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Arrege
Reviews.Content: We were in town for 3 days attending a conference. Most of our time was spent outside - so we were only in the room to to eat and sleep in the evenings. My wife go a great deal on a suite - Bedroom + Den - and the room was on the high floor. The suites are clean and comfortable, they come with a full kitchen, stove, microwave, dishwasher and full fridge. This is great since you can buy food locally from a grocery store and just cook in the room. Also, any unwashed dishes and silverware are cleaned by the staff the next day. The bathroom is spacious - though there is no bathtub. It's a standing shower only. There is a hot tub in the suite - right next to the bedroom. There is no door separating the hot tub from the bedroom - so you can see it from your bed. We did not have time to use it - so I cannot comment on it much more Parking is free - both covered and outdoor. There's also a small convenient store within the hotel itself that's open till 11 pm or so. The hotel also has a pool that people appeared to be enjoying and a business center. Bed was large - and the room was pretty quiet. There may be some noise early in the day - random lour car or siren - but it's not the norm. The only issue for us was that the room had a very poor internet connection. We use MACs and had trouble connecting to email using our computers - even after calling tech support to trouble shoot. So we ended up using WEBMAIL to get our work done. But it was still too slow and frustrating. I would stay at this hotel again - since the deal is great, the location is good, and I can manage with the web connection.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thommos17
Reviews.Content: 2 bedroom apartment was lovely and spacious with a full kitchen. Staff were very friendly and interacted well with our children. Lovely swimming pool. It is a bit of a walk to the strip and back but if you have your own car a great tip is that there is free parking at any of the big casinos on the strip. You can park your own car or have it valet parked for just a tip when you collected it. (US $2) is what we were told was appropriate. This was a much cheaper option that the monorail at $5 per one way trip and made our stay much more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: lososos62
Reviews.Content: this is a very good hotel, no doubts. we booked a day in advance, and when the hotels on the strip like the mirage and the TI were at $150 and over, this was $100. since we had the car the fact this is off the strip did not really bother us. we had the studio suite, overlooking the stratosphere, it was quite an interesting view. the overall quality was very good, but here are few things I really did not like: the king bed was very soft, it did no go too well with my back the pools is nice, but you can't escape the music, that was too loud for me. I would not go back just for this reason. check out is at 10am: first time I see a check out so early! vacation is when I get 8-9 hours of sleep, that is hard to do if you also do not want to feel rushed in the morning. another reason I am not going back. it is still a very good hotel, I would recommend it to anyone who does not care about these 3 things above.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - convenient to Monorail”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a fine place to stay if you want a place to escape to for peace and quiet. One of the drawbacks is that since it is a timeshare property, it's not like a traditional hotel experience. For example, room cleaning only occurs every 4 days, other days you need to clean up after yourself. However, the unit comes with a complete kitchen including washer and drier. It's just a short walk to the monorail station at the Hilton which will take to you to main Vegas strip area. If you're looking for a bustling environment, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay in Vegas off the strip”
Reviews.Author: ChefFatCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton vacations club for 2 days when we visited Las Vegas in July. We were recommended this hotel from our RCI membership and we were very glad we booked it. It is just off the las Vegas strip on the north end, and right next to the Hilton hotel and convention center. We had a roomy 2 bedroom suite (1200sq feet) with all the amenities of home - full kitchen, king beds, plasma TVs, whirlpool tubs, 2 full baths etc) For about $160 per night this is a very good deal in Vegas and well worth it. Although the hotel is not nearly as elaborate as most of the ones on the strip, it is great for families and because it is just off the strip, it is quite quiet. The pool area is a little simple but does the job. There is a little coffee/gift shop but no restaurants on site. There is also no casino which may be a good/bad thing depending on why you are there. Mind you everything is just a stones throw away if you want all of the Las Vegas action. The service was very friendly and accommodating. Parking is on site but a little bit of a walk if you use the underground parking. You will need to use your car or the monorail service if you want to go out to the strip - you can walk it but it is a little far for most people, and with the las Vegas heat it might be a tad uncomfortable. All in all I would recommend this hotel for families, long stays, and for people that don't want the hustle and bustle and crowds of the major hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: cppexpert
Reviews.Content: Normally I stay on the Strip - Bally's, Wynn or Caesars but since we were driving from Arizona to California I wanted inexpensive accommodation with good quality. Hilton is great - awesome value for 80$ I paid! Rooms are clean, sofa bed is pretty big for one more person, pool isn't big but nice. Wii gameconsole, pool and table tennis are available for those who bored. Location isn't that far from the strip if you're on the car. If I need

Reviews.Title: “good location-rooms could use upgrades”
Reviews.Author: seasunsounds
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this vegas hotel for a few days in june. It was hot as heck in vegas during june but for some reason the hotel does not have umbrellas for pool guest. You can rent cabanas but there is very little shade in 100++++ heat. The room was comfortable but small and the bathroom was not big enough for two people to maneuver around in, coffee drinkers have to go downstairs to the ONE cafe or wander over to the other side of the hotel for more breakfast type items and buy there is no coffee pot in the room but there was a fridge. The bathtub faucet leaked and I had trouble turning it off. The staff in the diner on the first floor were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: andrew340
Reviews.Content: as usual, a very enjoyable stay. The rooms are spacious although I feel are beginning to look a little worn. Nonetheless, spotless and everything in good repair. one broken glass and a toaster were replaced within 15 minutes of me calling housekeeping. The pool area is delightful. No loud music to spoil the tranquility - also ample shade and misters to help keep you cool. If you want a party atmosphere and loud music, look elsewhere. if you want a relaxing base with the option of self catering then you can't beat it. Significantly better than Wyndham Grand Desert.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel at great value”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTraveler73
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay in a one bedroom suite during the Independence Day weekend. At about $100 a night, it was a great value - compared to the other hotels along the Vegas Strip during the holiday weekend. Our room came with a fully equipped kitchen, a washer/dryer, a separate bedroom with a king bed, a living room with a sofabed and a jacuzzi tub. I slept on the sofabed, which was adequate for a night but not as plush and comfy as the regular bed. Our room location near the very top was quiet and we had a great view of the Stratosphere Tower. The reception area is rather small - but no smoke filled noisy long hallways, thankfully. They also have a separate spacious lobby/business room, recreation room, a deli and a pool/jacuzzi outside. As for the service, the staff were generally friendly and accommodating. Check in and check out was an easy process too. When we summoned housekeeping, someone arrived promptly with some extra toiletries; they even allowed us to check out late, around noon. As others mentioned, the hotel is not in the busiest part of the Strip where the major hotels are located, but you can easily use the monorail to get around; or just walk across to the nearby Hilton Hotel if you want more dining and entertainment options. Overall, this is a great property for those looking for spacious rooms with a relaxed and quiet atmosphere at a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: daplushman
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. I've been to Vegas a few times over the last year and a half and this was the best hotel I've stayed at. I had a 1 bedroom suite with a jazzuci with a great view of the golf course. The location was great for me because it was a short walk to the convention center (over 100 degrees every day during the week so I really appreciated the short walk). There was a kitchenette and a washer and dryer in the room. I didn't get any sales pitch to buy into the vacation suites so that was great. If I wanted to gamble, a short walk to the Hilton Las Vegas with their casino was all it took. Overall, a very nice facility and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Mspill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom timeshare for a week, Saturday to Saturday. It was a one bedroom with a one bedroom lock out to make the two bedrooms. The wifi is free although on Thursday the internet was down all day, but the rest of the day was fine. I felt the staff was very attentive, towels were replaced upon request and on the fourth day of the stay our room was refreshed, new towels, dishwasher run, beds made. Very nice. Newspaper every day to the room. Towels are provided at the pool, there is a bar poolside that had drink specials during the week. Magazines are provided poolside too. Exercise room was good, scale, and filtered water was provided. Deli was small but good in a pinch, we walked across the street to a mini-mart, beer was much cheaper than at the deli. The monorail was an 8 minute walk through the Hilton next door. Most of the week we used the Monorail, clean convenient and runs every 6 minutes. You can also pick up the Ace Bus which is an 8 minute walk in front of the Monorail at the Sahara going Southbound. You can pick up both the Ace and Deuce Bus on the strip in front of the Sahara going Northbound and Southbound. This is a little farther, closer to a 10-12 minute walk through the casino. The Ace is an express and the Deuce is a local. We went to many Wolfgang Puck Restaurants. Spago @ Caesars, Lupo @ Mandolay Bay, Postrio @ Venitian, Bar and Grill @ MGM. All top notch- I loved them all. We also went to Timpano Tavern in the Venetian, very good, but not as good as Wolfgang. At the California in Freemont Street, we had the biggest bargain meal at Pirate Pasta, an 8 oz sirloin and lobster tail , glass wine and salad for $16.00. Loved our time there!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: luvbnarn
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this location, it was very nice, clean and comfortable. The staff were fantastic and went above and beyond to provide accommodations for our needs. It was a very short walk to reach the tram for travel throughout the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and relaxing after a long day/night on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaAllie
Reviews.Content: In reading over some of the other reviews, I realize some are actually reviewing the Las Vegas Hilton HOTEL – located next door – rather than the Hilton Grand Vacations (Convention Center). Therefore, read reviews carefully to make an informed decision and be sure the review matches the correct property. This is a ‘resort-type’ property and not a typical Las Vegas hotel. There is no casino and no buffet or fine dining restaurants directly on the premises. With that said, you can take the 5-minute walk over to the Las Vegas Hilton hotel which has a large casino and multiple fine-dining options as well as a nice buffet and plenty of fast-food restaurants. The only dining option on the HGVC site is a deli which sells cold/hot sandwiches, snacks, Starbucks coffee, salads, fruit, microwave frozen food, supplies, etc. (It is not open late, so plan ahead if you like to snack late at night!) My husband and I enjoyed the relaxed and quiet atmosphere of HGVC. After a long day/night on the Strip, it was wonderful to come back to a property that wasn’t crowded with people shopping, gambling or eating. If you want to be constantly in the action and crowds, this may not be the best property for you; however, if you want to RELAX when you get back to your room, consider this property. HGVC is not directly on the Strip, nor is it within ‘walking distance’. The Monorail is an inexpensive way to avoid traffic and there is a Monorail stop across the street at the Las Vegas Hilton. Be informed and study the Monorail map. It doesn’t stop directly at all attractions and hotels. Many destinations are far from Monorail stops – it all depends on where you want to go, some hotels/attractions are close to the stops. If you can, rent a car when in Vegas. Parking is abundant and free. The Strip is pretty congested, but you can drive directly to the hotels/casinos/attractions. It is also useful if you want to explore the surrounding areas. (Which I strongly suggest you do!) There is a nice pool area, but it seemed a bit small and was always crowded. Desk workers and hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed in a nice one-bedroom suite. Some other reviewers complained of ‘thin walls’ and of hearing voices from adjacent rooms. We did not have this problem – we heard them open/shut their door, but that is all. The kitchen was nicely stocked with dishes and utensils. The appliances were nice. The bedroom, bedding and mattress were all comfortable. (Pillows were a bit stiff) OK… now to my only true complaint… we were constantly asked to participate in a time-share presentation. They called our room a few times plus asked us about it every time we passed the desk upon entering/leaving. I didn’t feel “pressured” and it was all done in a nice, friendly way… but it did get VERY annoying in that they didn’t easily take “no’” for an answer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Maybe Needs Some Updating”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_From_CA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom suite with a buddy for the weekend. Can't speak for all of the rooms of course, but our room was in need of updating in the near future. It was fine for us and I thought a good value at $125 per night. I would stay here again for the location and the price. There is no casino in this hotel which I prefer. It is nice to get away from the non-stop action when coming back to the hotel. It just feels more relaxed. The Hilton and Sahara casinos are walking distance. The location is great, halfway between the airport and downtown and close to everything on the Strip. Best of all, this hotel is off the Strip (but very close) so that you can avoid all of the traffic. The main bed was comfortable and the bathroom was large. The double sink was nice to have. The sofa bed was your typical uncomfortable lumpy mess. I put the mattress on the floor and slept better. They have a nice small pool that was never crowded. We had a couple of margaritas one afternoon out there after returning from Red Rock Canyon, good drinks and relaxing. There was also a ping pong table and pool table in the lobby available for use. Overall a good value and I would recommend staying here. There was no high intensity sales pitch for buying into the vacation club. It is not as nice as The Signature at MGM, but it is also alot cheaper. The only problem area I would report is that sleeping on the sofa bed in the living room can be noisy. We had a room with a connecting door to the next room, and every whisper from that room could be clearly heard through the door.

Reviews.Title: “Decent option”
Reviews.Author: hobbyistravel
Reviews.Content: We traveled here to celebrate an in-laws birthday, so we were parents, young kids, grandparents. We booked an apartment to avoid the hustle/bustle of the strip, and to save a bit of money, since it came with two bedrooms and a sofa-bed. It is next door to the big Hilton, and we used the pool there once (nice but a really long walk back in wet swimming costumes). The front desk staff are quite friendly and nice, and the place was pretty quiet. The room was clean enough, and the housekeeping staff did a nice job. We went to the nearby WholeFoods and stocked up the kitchen for a week, which also saved us money on having to eat out very much. We did miss the free breakfasts you get at a "real" hotel, but other than that, it was nice. If you like apartments rather than hotel rooms, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay at, if you want to save your quarters in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: RyanColombo
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is right next to the Hilton Las Vegas and about 500 meters away from the convention center. Its a good hotel if you want to avoid the typical Vegas scene (the gambling and the crowds) and attend a convention. The suites are of good size, a large kitchen with a full sized fridge, oven, microwave, dishwasher, toaster etc. The Sitting room was large as well with a 32" flat screen with a DVD player in addition to the one in the bed room.
